Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: fatherhen
Reviews.Content: My wife and children voted this hotel the best hotel of our entire Arizona trip. It had the most comfortable beds and blankets. The most user friendly bathroom. Free WIFI. Above average breakfast spread. And the lowest price. And a free soda fountain and a free pop corn making machine to keep the kids happy. It may not be near the city centre. But it is right off the I17 so it is really an excellent choice for a road trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Carol G
Reviews.Content: Went on a family vacation with kids and grandkids and this hotel was ideal. Very clean and comfortable rooms. We arrived at midnight and our 2 rooms were non-smoking and together, as requested. Breakfast and happy hour was a bonus and worked out well, especially for the grandkids. Shopping center is close by with a Wal-Mart, movie theaters, restaurants, etc. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a good experience and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Was alright”
Reviews.Author: tynkerbell44
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money we paid to stay there this past weekend, I was kinda disappointed. We got to our room and noticed on the couch was crusted (I hope it was) food on all the cushions. We had to turn them over to sit down. We didnt have enough towels for 3 people. The dinner was ok, but was told on the website there would be chicken, no chicken. The adult drinks were so watered down you couldn't even taste the alcohol . According to the website, this hotel had an indoor pool, (one reason why we chose this hotel) and when we got there, it was partly inclosed. The water was freezing. Kids were running and splashing and staff would walk by and not do a thing. The breakfast was ok. Some food was just not good at all. Also the oj was warm. Also when we wanted to watch tv, all the stations were staticy. The beds were comfortable, and the front desk staff was great. I would probably not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money north of Phoenix...”
Reviews.Author: MICHELLE L
Reviews.Content: We were there in late March for spring training and to see some other attractions. I booked here because of the other Tripadvisor positive reviews and concur that is it very good value for the money. A newer property which is nice, and as such flat screens and wi-fi. The free local calls and 1 hr of LD calls per night also handy. Each night they have a "Kickback" event so free sift drinks, liquor and food in the same area where the free beakfasts are. Quite well done as nachos, hotdogs, mac & cheese, veggies, so hard to argue as it is free. A bit more variety would be good, but I wouldn't recommend eating there each night, so serves the intended purpose. Exercise area fairly small & basic, and pool on the small side too, so if you & your kids really want that than this may not be a good fit. We stayed at the Drury 5 nights, then did 2 nights at the Arizona Grand Resort so the latter fulfilled our desire to have some awesome pool/waterslide time. Staff accomodating, and eventhough property filed to the brim with baseball players & their families I thought they did a good job keeping on top of the breakfasts and housecleaning. Area by check in desk with 2 computers and a common printer so that is always nice. Location wise, easy access off the 101, but truly it is very North of Phoenix (on border of Happy Valley), so if you want to be central not ideal. Nice mall 1 exit north (can access via street so don't need to get back on the highway), and also Applebees & many other restaurants to pick from. Rooms quite spacious. We had the suite, so 1 bedroom with 2 queen beds 7 flat screen TV, and another main area with a pull-out coach and it's own TV which is a bonus. Fridge in our room a bonus & bathrooms did the trick too as newer & quite clean. Nice to get a USA Today & breakfasts more than sufficient, and again free, so overall we were all quite pleased. Hope that is helpful, and we would certainly stay there again in Phoenix if we wanted to be based north of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice northern Phoenix location.”
Reviews.Author: heidi84
Reviews.Content: Very slow elevator here. Nice bath tile. No lotion. No comforter. Breakfast was better than most Marriotts but the evening meal was not as good as Residence Inn (located very nearby). Lady serving at the evening bar was rude and never smiled. Hotel is nicely located for quick highway access.

Reviews.Title: “Love the "Extras"- Clean, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: JulieJCincinnatiOH
Reviews.Content: We were greeted immediately by the staff. We arrived a little early and they let us know where to go close by until the room was ready. This location was very clean throughout. The breakfast hit the spot with a very nice variety. The 3 drinks (including alcohol) and food is well worth getting at 530. It works as a snack or small dinner for some. Close by a shopping area and the highway. It is a good location for springtraining baseball games. Close by for many ball parks. Sedona is an hour trip and we made it to the Grand Canyon in about 3 hours!! Stay at Drury !!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: jpb56
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a light snack at night so eat a big lunch . I'm talking chips and salsa, hot dogs(which I didn't have) one night chicken fingers (they were good). The place was packed every night and every morning, We had good value and would stay again, the front desk staff were very helpful. Thanks for the nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Drury Chain”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippersx2Chicao
Reviews.Content: Great staff, wonderful hotel. Breakfast is one of the best. Didn't take part in the evening meal, we were gone during that time frame. Only complaint I would have with it is the Bud beer!!!! Hot tub was clean and hot. Room large and comfy. North of the Phoenix area, but only blocks from the highway. Rates are better than other hotels we looked at in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndianOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here for 5 nights. They provide 3 free drinks and dinner but the dinner is not worth having as it consists of baked potato and hot dogs and such ordinary foods. We tried their gin and tonic but we felt that the gin was not alcoholic. The gin was on tap which is very unusual! Breakfast was substantial.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints. Perfectly fine hotel but not luxurious .”
Reviews.Author: C001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night passing through Phoenix to go to Sedona. The hotel is perfectly fine. The morning breakfast is a real breakfast and it's not half bad. It was perfectly fine. No real complaints. My one thought on it is that we should have been able to get a better deal on the room rate. It seemed a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Newish affordable north Phoenix Hotel with free perks”
Reviews.Author: ready29
Reviews.Content: Free is their motto: breakfast, internet, parking, popcorn + soda in lobby, happy hour food+drinks (not for the health conscious) New and modern with small fridge in room. Shopping ctr. nearby with movie theater, P.F. Chang and TJ Max. North of 101 loop with 25 minute drive to central Phoenix or Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2seniorcitizens
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 4 and room still not ready at 5 so manager graciously cut our rate in half which was appreciated. Could not believe the full supper they provide for their guests as well as a hot breakfast with many varieties of food. Beautiful decor and furnishings and very friendly staff. Only complaint would be that hot tub had a problem the night we stayed but looked like it got fixed overnight. This is a great place to stay and certainly on our list to return when visiting Phoenix. Not close to downtown but good location for anyone holding north.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beds”
Reviews.Author: jimmegb
Reviews.Content: I went to visit my daughter who is going to college in Arizona. It was spring break. We stayed two nights and enjoyed our stay. I went there thinking it would be quiet. It was probably the wrong time to go for that. Many of the guests had small kids. The rooms were not as quiet as I remember Drury Inns being. The breakfast and evening drinks and food were pretty crazy, but tolerable. They ran out of things like coffee cups and hot appetizers, but they were very responsive and did their best to keep up. The main thing that my daughter and I enjoyed were the beds. I should have looked at the mattress maker. They were extremely comfortable. My daughter, who sleeps on dorm room beds thought it was the the best part of the stay. It was hard to get up in the morning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I recommend this hotel, but don't expect a sound proof room.

Reviews.Title: “More than you can ask for.”
Reviews.Author: Sheila3003
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and new Hotel. The service is good, and the extra amenities adds a special feature to this hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortably nice. I recommend this Hotel, it is out of the toursit area and away from the central/downtown area of Phoenix, easily assessable to the I-17 Freeway. What to expect? Popcorn in the lobby - Free, Full Breakfast - Free, Cocktail hour food - Freee, a good assortment. Juice/Soda Free. I say with all the free stuff, hey you can't go wrong. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Royals2012
Reviews.Content: We came to town for Spring Training and were treated to 5 Star service by a GREAT staff, a clean beautiful room, delicious breakfast and evening appetizers with drinks. We visited several places around Phoenix and this proved to be a good location. On our next trip to Phoenix you know where to find us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TouristLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Drury from Feb 25-28. This is the second hotel from this chain I've stayed at. The hotel is just north of the city so it's a little out of the way. However, it's right off the I-17 so getting around is easy. We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 7th floor and the room was quiet. There was a kids' soccer tournament the first night and while the breakfast and Kickback were crowded, we had no trouble with noise at night. The one bedroom suite had a good sized living room. From there is a hallway that has a long counter top where the coffeemaker and fridge are kept. The bedroom had a very nice, large King-sized bed. We really enjoyed the buffet breakfast and Kickback. The pool and whirlpool were fine. Nearby is a shopping area complete with lots of restaurants, shops, and a movie theatre. The only negative thing I can say is that not all rooms are non-smoking. Getting off the elevator onto our floor it's quite evident that people do smoke in the hotel. Thankfully we didn't smell any stale smoke in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even bother looking anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Shawn H
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel. I only wish it were in more places. I've only stayed in this location. Great staff. Great breakfast, and free dinner served daily. What other hotel has free dinner!? Pool area is fantastic with half of the pool indoors and the other half outdoors. I stayed there for 2 weeks. Absolutely loved my stay. I won't stay in any other hotel when I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: wyzeguys
Reviews.Content: Large room, LCD TV, excellent breakfast, and wonderful "Kickback" @5:30pm-who needed dinner after that(plus up to 3drinks/night included, including alcohol) only negatives: no heat lamp in bathrooms(get cold in am during showers) b) whirlpool continually "sudsy"- unable to use would definitely come back again

Reviews.Title: “DEAL OF THE CENTURY”
Reviews.Author: Debimlee
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay one more night, and Drury was "on the way" out of town. The price was right, the reviews were good, it's new, clean and a great value. We got here in time for the nightly "dinner", which saved us from having to go out again. It's served in the same room they use for breakfast in the morning, from 5:30 to 7:00 pm. Tonight they offered Boneless Buffalo Chicken, Baked Potatoes, Hot Dogs with bun, Tortilla Chips with Salsa, Toppings of Seasoned ground beef, Refried beans, Cheese sauce, jalapenos, Salad with 2 kinds of dressing, carrot and celery stix. Pop and Virgin drinks are free, and every guest gets 3 free alcohol drinks. We don't drink alcohol, but the Virgin Tequila Sunrise was good (minus the Tequila, so I guess it's just a Sunrise) as was the Virgin Margarita (with salt, the best part). Will try the breakfast in the morning, and if it's anything like tonights offerings, I'm sure we won't be dissapointed. Hot Breakfast is served from 6:00 to 9:30 am. The room is large, has a big closet with a full length mirror. Microwave, fridge, and lots of drawer space is a bonus. Free Wireless, large flat screen tv, large bathroom with tub. The beds are very comfortable. 60 minutes of free long distance per night, per room. Talk to Canada or Mexico for 15 minutes free per night. There is a guest laundry and 1 day dry cleaning available. Free popcorn in the lobby. The place is clean and new. At $110 a night for 2 beds, complete with dinner and breakfast, this place is the deal of the century.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: alvis-f
Reviews.Content: Our third visit...That should tell you something! And I can be a #%^&!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice if Staying in North Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: scarlett329
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night while doing business near Happy Valley Parkway (10 minutes away). Nothing bad to say. Location close to freeway was good, free hot buffet breakfast was good, evening reception looked good although we had already eaten before getting there, but there were hot snacks like chips and salsa, hot dogs with chili sauce, and other things that could very well have been a meal. Plus they gave you vouchers for a couple free drinks from the bar! What a value. Rooms and service everything was top notch. No complaints. Those that say it's "too far out", not to be mean but book a hotel closer to what you're wanting to do. It IS far out from downtown Phoenix but I'm willing to bet there are hundreds of hotels right in downtown Phoenix. This hotel for us was 10 minutes away from the company we had business with. Lots of shopping and restaurants close by. Hope this helps my fellow travelers. :) /scarlett329

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DotComMomm
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great, helpful staff. The free food was just okay, but it was free. Very quiet hotel. Good location, made it easy to get places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Richard L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Drury Inn & Suite for one day during my trip. The hotel is excellent, especially at this rate. It is a little far from the airport, at Pinnacle Peak, but location is not bad, close to highway and surprisingly quiet at night. Building is very new, room is spacy and clean. Big LCD TV and free wireless internet, and the internet speed is the best among the chain hotels I've ever stayed. Staffs are very nice. When we arrived at dinner time the front desk lady was helping at the dining area. A kind note was left at the front desk, and the lady showed up in half minute when we tried to find her. Free snacks and drinks during dinner time, and good breakfast too. This is not a luxery resort but at a rate of $80 this is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Bookworm-grl
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. The hotel is new, spacious, and clean. The staff was courteous and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Extras Make It Well Worth The Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gillian_Speed
Reviews.Content: Location: Nice area of phoenix, not too busy. Located just next to the I17 for easy travelling around town. Despite being in such close proximity to the interstate we could not hear any traffic noise form our room (which had a view of the road). A Walmart can be found 2 blocks up which is open 24 hours. Hotel: Very clean and well presented. Check-in was very smooth and efficient and all the extras unique to the Drury chain were explained. Pool area was small but it was quiet; hot tub was nice however the heated outdoor/indoor pool was rather cold! The business center was very useful. There is two computers and one printer with note pads, staplers etc. Only negative comment here is that the internet speed was quite slow. Room: Nicely decorated and clean. Some extra storage areas would have been nice however there was a small wardrobe and 6 drawers as well as a bedside cabinet. Great having three mirrors (one in bathroom; two in room). Air-con/heating was displaying inaccurate temperatures so we had to constantly re-adjust the settings. Some noise could be heard from the neighboring rooms as the walls were quite thin. Extras: Breakfast had a great choice of hot and cold food. No one should be going hungry here (and i'm a very fussy eater!). Choices usually included: sausage, egg, biscuits, bread, bagels, fruit, yogurt, cereal and more. Popcorn and soft drinks were available which were nice snacks. Dinner was excellent with a choice of hot dogs, chicken, mac & cheese, chips etc. Three alcoholic drinks were also available every night, just show your card to the host and they will mark it off.

Reviews.Title: “For a mid-level service hotel, this is a great place.”
Reviews.Author: EastC0ast9
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels all across the country, from the Bellagio in Las Vegas to the Hampton Inn in McLean, Va to finer hotels in Europe and I can tell you this, none of them give you better value for the money than this Drury Inn. Is the breakfast great? No. But it's okay and it's great if you're in a hurry. Of course, the breakfast buffet at Drury Inn can't compare to being served a nice breakfast by a pleasant waiter in a comfortable upscale restaurant, but still the food is good and you don't have to waste time waiting for service. It's fast, do it yourself, and it's included in the cost of your room. So to are the afternoon drinks (limit three per person) and the afternoon/evening hors d'oeuvres. These are good enough to substitute for a meal if you don't have time to get out to a restaurant. Again, not haute cuisine, but good and nice to have available in a pinch. (Plus they have popcorn that you can scoop into bags for free throughout the evening). And one huge plus for anyone traveling on business... they have wi-fi and IT WORKS! For me, this is critical and much appreciated. Another plus is the washer and dryer. They have a coin operated laundry facility on the 7th floor, which is great to have when you've packed only enough luggage to fit in an airplanes overhead bins. You only need to pack for a few days, then you can wash your clothes as many times as needed over the duration of your trip. The staff was excellent, although I made no special requests of anyone so I didn't really "put them to the test". Everyone was friendly and our 6 day stay was pleasant from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice place to stay if it's available when I'm going.”
Reviews.Author: NissanDragger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my friend's wedding - they put us up in the hotel as I was performing as the DJ at the reception for them. Had never been before, and I was impressed. Did get to see the bill, and while not the lowest price but you get a lot for what you pay - the hotel staff at this location was very friendly, very attentive, and very informative about the area when asked. The room itself was comfortable, well furnished, and very clean. The best part of the whole thing to me - the breakfast experience was amazing. All included with the stay, they had a full buffet style breakfast at no charge! Not only that, but the food was actually rather good, and the choices were well varied. I was also informed they provide lunch items as well, but did not get to try that out due to timing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, good rooms, free extras”
Reviews.Author: ExPunkLondon
Reviews.Content: First off, the staff. They were, without exception, very pleasant and very efficient. Nothing appeared to be too much trouble.We'd arrived mid-day after one of those nightmare journeys and they were able to get us into a room straight away. The room itself was spotlessly clean and, although ours faced onto a road that gets a little busy at peak times, noise wasn't a problem. The location is on the northern edge of Phoenix just past the loop road (101). Its close to a junction of Highway 17, so easy to find, and is about 25 mins from the airport by car. Although it's a large hotel, it is a limited service model - so there's no restaurant or bar (except 5.50-7PM, see below). There's nowhere to eat or drink in walking distance so you would need to drive somewhere. However, they do have a guest pantry if you need to buy snacks, microwave meals, drinks etc) Now for the freebies - Free wi-fi: Good cover, both in the communal areas and our room, with very good speeds - fast enough to stream video. Breakfast was included with the room rate and there was plenty of it and plenty of choice. Free booze! - At 5.30 every evening they have what they call Kickback - which is basically free food & drinks for an hour and a half. Each guest gets 3 free drinks(choice of wine, beer or cocktails), and there's a good choice of hot and cold snacks - enough to make a light/mid size evening meal. Great if you're jet lagged and just want a few drinks and something to eat before crashing out. Free calls - an hour of free long distance (not int'l) a day. Pool: apparently there is one, but we didn't look for it. Tourist tip: About ten minutes away is the Deer Valley Rock Art Center, where you can see native American rock art covering 2-3000 years. Well worth an look if you have time. Overall a great place to stay if you don't need full service.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AZGMA
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, comfortable beds, pleasent staff and large rooms. Couldn't ask for more. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Francis D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was friendly. We had no problems whatsoever. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Inlawsandoutlaws
Reviews.Content: Fairly new, very clean hotel property. It was our first stay with Drury Inn & Suites, but probably not our last. They seem to do things quite well and offer a great deal of services to keep guests satisfied. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Rooms were comfortable and well-equipped with all the necessities. They offer free beverages (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) as well as substantial "snacks" in the evening - enough food that if you're not a huge eater there's no need to go to dinner. The breakfast the next morning was one of the most complete included buffets that I've seen in a hotel. I don't know if all Drury Inns are this nice, but we received an excellent value for our money and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Easy”
Reviews.Author: sailorman9
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay on our way to Wickenberg. We have stayed at Drury Hotels before and they never disappoint! Free dinner, free drinks, free breakfast. All good. This hotel is clean and new and worth a visit. Stay here you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Always Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rdtrppr
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, great food, nice staff. No complaints here. Worth the little bit of an extra drive. We stay here every time we are in the area and have yet to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: GetawayWestCoast
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this property, which appeared to be brand new and was sparkling clean at every turn. The staff was friendly and helpful, yet nonintrusive. The included extras - such as the breakfast and evening hot snacks and beverages - were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Bambu_10
Reviews.Content: We flew into Phoenix after a weeks holiday in New York and at the beginning of a 2wk road trip around Arizona.The Hotel looks brand new and yes it is on the outskirts of town.The room was large,extremely clean and comfortable and included in the price was a hot buffet breakfast,an evening buffet meal (with drinks).It suited our purpose perfectly I wouldn"t hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway”
Reviews.Author: emily2233
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here on a whim after going on a private plane flying lesson. The room was beautiful and the staff attentive. Will definitely try it again if we find ourselves in those neck of the woods again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and Safe”
Reviews.Author: DINI1968
Reviews.Content: This hotel came highly recommended by Mike at AZ Hummer Tours. We went for one night and ended up staying for two. We got a terrific rate with a roomsaver guide coupon.Breakfast had plenty of options as did the evening reception.My family loved the unlimited popcorn and softdrinks throughout the night. The pool water is chilly but the hot tub is good and hot. Each adult 21 and over also is treated to 3 alcoholic beverages between 5:30 and 7:00 each night.The staff is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel. Perfect stopover on the way to Sedona”
Reviews.Author: GRC-11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Inn when we arrived in Arizona. We were looking for a hotel that was on the way to Sedona. Drury was perfect solution. Affordable, clean, good breakfast, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TencatNewMexico
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and would have stayed longer if they hadn't been sold out! The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The suite we got was a corner suite that was HUGE and very sound proof as it was tucked back behind a small inner 'dining' area with the fridge and a table. The only complaint we had is that the pool is COLD, which might feel good when it's 110 degrees, but not when it's 60 degrees. Breakfast was nice with lots of hot food options, waffles, cereal, and yogurt. The beds were comfortable, and I think they listened to one of the reviewers here who said the headboards were loose, because ours was tightly nailed to the wall :). We will be sure to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jnlk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights, during the day we traveled to Scottsdale and Carefree. We stayed in a suite, which was plenty of room. The hotel is new, and it was clean. The staff was friendly. The free breakfast and evening kickback meal made it an even better value. We would stay here again if we return to this area. Side note -- there was no bathroom fan, and no facial tissue in the bathroom dispenser. We found the Happy Valley shopping center handy (very near the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Good Economy Stay - but fix the d*mn headboards!”
Reviews.Author: YVRme
Reviews.Content: Went down to Phoenix to see the Canucks play the Coyotes and stayed at a fantastic Spa Resort near Scottsdale for 2 nights prior to heading over to the Glendale area to meet other friends to watch the game and stay at Drury. The hotel is new and clean and pretty well set up (pretty much what you'd expect from this type of hotel). Our big problem came when trying to sleep. They have these faux wood headboards that hang on the wall and are not affixed at the bottom. I'm guessing the folks in the suite next to us were on the heavy side and every time they tossed (every 3-5 minutes) their headboard would make a sharp 'bang-bang-bang' noise at our heads. Even with earplugs in, we only got 2-3 hours sleep. When asked how my stay was on checkout I said straight out that we only got a couple hours of sleep and were exhausted...the rep simply said, I'm sorry to hear that and gave us our bill. Won't be going back. Hopefully they fix the problem. For a hockey game I will look at Renaissance next time...it's right beside the rink.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Visit!”
Reviews.Author: debmik
Reviews.Content: Our coach had picked this hotel and I wasn't sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful it was. The price was right, the food was good, the room was very nice and we slept well. This is a great find for us! It's one of those places that I want to let everyone know about but on the other hand not to, so it will not be sold out when we want to go! shhh!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Family Hotel - No Water Park!”
Reviews.Author: jbldr
Reviews.Content: I have been booking hotels based on trip advisor recommendations for years, and this is the first time I've been steered wrong. The main issue is the photos on TripAdvisor that shows the Wet and Wild Waterpark as the first photo of the hotel. My family and I were looking forward to a week in Phoenix at a nice hotel with a great pool. The pictures are completely misleading. The Water Park is down the street, and was closed during our stay. Had it been open it would have been only $75 per day for my family to go there each day!! The rest of the hotel's claims are accurate - it is newer, they serve free food at 5pm hot dogs (if you get there in the first 5 minutes) tyson chicken bites, microwave egg rolls, chips and celery/carrots. We ate there, and were immediately sorry. The breakfast is the same quality. You get what you pay for. The pool was the biggest disappointment. It was small, and absolutely freezing. There was no-one in the pool - no other families. It was so cold that we had to take our three year old to swim in the hot tub for 5 minutes at a time. And the stench of chlorine was overwhelming. The adjacent "fitness center" contains only cardio - one bike and three treadmills. No weights or even a ball. This is a business hotel - for a business traveller that wants to eat junk food for dinner. I could hardly mask my disappointment when I checked in. The first thing I did in my room was get online and book another hotel. We ended up going to the Tapatio Cliffs Resort, which I could have booked in advance at $169, but ended up costing us $204 per day for the rest of our stay. Don't be fooled by this place - it is not a resort, not a family hotel, not a vacation location. I also find it hard to believe it was rated #1 in Phoenix - no way.

Reviews.Title: “An average motel with some reservation system problems...”
Reviews.Author: gv69
Reviews.Content: The staff must be writing all those glowing reviews or the folks who wrote them must stay exclusively in motels - this is certainly not the #1 "hotel" in all of Phoenix by ANY stretch of the imagination. The rooms are mediocre. The bathroom has one bottle of shampoo and conditioner combined and two bars of soap (face and bath)- that is it- no moisturers or lotions (critical in Phoenix given the low levels of humidity), nothing else Yes, the room has an empty fridge and a microwave but not even a bottle of water. My room was not made up during my stay and when I checked out, I found out that they did not even know that I had checked-in two days ago i.e., they did not know that I was staying at their hotel!!! I was lucky that they did not assign my room to someone else while I was still staying in it!!! They promised to email me the receipt (they could not generate one for a stay that they did not have a record of :-)) and took my email address- my credit card got billed but I have not seen the emailed receipt yet. The location was okay for me because it was close to work but it is ~25 miles from the airport which could be 30 min- 1 hour depending on the time of day and the traffic. Overall, an average motel with some reservation system problems.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: Trader1109
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded every one of my expectations, from the telephone reservation to checkout no problems at all. The room was quality, quiet with plenty of counter space and desk space. Internet was FAST! Near shopping and dining. I will be back! Nuff said! It was a pleasure to spend a week there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loulabell_10
Reviews.Content: The good: * The hotel staff were very helpful. We arrived early afternoon and the staff were more than happy to let us have an early check in to our hotel room and gave us information on the area * The hotel room was a great size with very comfortable beds * The free evening snacks were so big we didn’t need any dinner. Combine this with the free wine it was fantastic * The free breakfast was very tasty The bad: * The room itself was very dark but I found this to be the case with most American hotel rooms

Reviews.Title: “So Good I Came Back”
Reviews.Author: alvis-f
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel which cares for the guests. The front desk is always available to help and resolve all concerns and answer questions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: ozziegirlz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and loved it! The rooms were great, the lobby with the fireplace was a great place to curl up and watch tv. The staff were super friendly and helpful, and the breakfast and 5.30 kickback was a fantastic added bonus. The food on offer wasn't the best I have eaten but there was a lot of variety and it was tasty. (Hence why I went back for seconds and thirds!) And although I wasn't travelling with a pet (child excluded!) I was impressed that it was a pet friendly hotel. I also found the location was good-short drive to shopping centres and very close to the main highway (no highway noise heard from inside the hotel!). I will definitely be returning here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “3 Words: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: cheryden
Reviews.Content: As first time guests at a Drury Inn, we didn't know what to expect outside of the TripAdvisor reviews. From the moment we stepped through the doors we were pleasantly surprised. Everything we encountered was beyond our expectations, from the service, the room, the breakfast, to the price. We did not take advantage of the "snacks and drinks" in the evening, or the workout room or pool, (our activities left no extra time), but if the common areas were any indication of the quality of the facilities, the rest will be great! Access to a small business center was nice, for checking e-mail, and there was plenty of comfortable lounging space, as well as a large breakfast room. As we checked out the desk clerk asked about our stay, I told him we would be writing a review on TripAdvisor, and I can definitely say we will stay at a Drury Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: luvthecaribbean
Reviews.Content: Can't not say enought good about our 3 night stay at Drury Inn Pinnacle Peak. From the front desk to the maid service in our room, everything was great! The location was handy on the northside, so was easy to get anywhere plus it was a quiet area. Loved the full breakfast in the mornings - our "chefs" were so friendly. And the option of the light dinner provided free in the evenings was wonderful (we did enjoy that one evening). We even enjoyed the indoor/outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for families!”
Reviews.Author: stephster123
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn is a great place to stay. With small children you can never underestimate the importance of snacks and a swimming pool, and the Drury Inn has both!!! Their evening happy hour spread and breakfast are great. In this day and age it is so nice to go somewhere and feel like you are getting true local hospitality! The price point and amenities will make me seek out the Drury Inn when we travel in the South in the future. One, thing... Watch out for the tile by the pool! It's really slick.

Reviews.Title: “We would come back :-)”
Reviews.Author: Heike090378
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends loved this hotel! The room was clean and comfortable and offered all you need to feel good on your holidays. The pool was not huge but great, we swam for hours! The food offered at breakfast and the evening reception was ok and plentiful, they even offered us free drinks. Every staff member we met was friendly and concered about making our stay the best it could be. We will certainly be looking for other Drury Inns on our future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not really in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: toastydave
Reviews.Content: Like all of the other reports, this hotel is made by its staff and more precisely the Manager who is very hands on. After a long drive through the hot desert, into the outskirts of even hotter Phoenix this air conditioned comfortable hotel was more than welcome. The Manager introduced himself and really made us feel at home and welcome. Its a new hotel and fairly anonymous, but like I say the staff make it. Its a great stop off point if your on a trip (i was driving from the Grand Canyon to LA) but business travellers note; its right on the edge of Phoenix to the north side would would be about a twenty mile trip into the centre of town

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SLOTRAV
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while picking a client up at Deer Valley Airport for an early morning flight. The great staff upgraded me to a Suite for no apparent reason, put me on the quiet to floor, and were all around top notch. I hope to stay at this and other Drury Inns from now on as this my first stay and I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: knt509
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn Pinnacle Peak is a very nice hotel. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff was very friendly on check-in and check-out. We were there on a Friday night so the menu that night included hot dogs, chili, baked potato, salad and chips & salsa. Definitely enough for a meal and it was good. I love the complemenatry cocktails. You get three. We will stay there again on our next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: lil_star04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and we had a wonderful stay! The hotel is fairly new and extremely clean. Breakfast is provided in the mornings and there is free popcorn and drinks in the afternoon. Dinner is also provided along with alcoholic drinks free. I am a vegetarian and there wasn't much on offer at dinner but otherwise it was great. The location of the hotel is great with happy valley towne centre being only 2 mins drive away. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Would definately recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Basically, everything you hate about chain hotels.”
Reviews.Author: vwjou
Reviews.Content: It's all what you expect from a $60/night chain hotel: boring, ugly, a big box in the middle of the desert. We stayed in a suite of some variety and the couch was something to avoid sitting on. The service at the front desk seemed nonplussed with basically everything, and I politely declined eating here. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Made Better By Drury!”
Reviews.Author: AcapulcoBound
Reviews.Content: Short review for those of you who don’t want to read the long review: it’s a great hotel and I highly recommend it! For those of you interested in details, here is the long review: This is the first vacation my wife and I have taken with our four year-old son. When he was younger we would vacation without him because he did not travel well (don’t worry, we left him with responsible grandparents). This year we felt he was old enough to try to travel with him so we went somewhere close. We live in Las Vegas and decided to go to Phoenix. We thought about staying at an expensive resort like when we travel without him, but thought it would be wasted on him. Thus, we decided to spend a week at Wet-N-Wild and looked for a hotel close to the water park. Tripadvisor led us to Drury, which turned out to be a great choice. With all the great amenities and the low price of the rooms, I wonder how this hotel chain stays in business. We stayed for five nights (July 5-9, 2010). On the first day we got to the hotel about 45 minutes before the 3:00 p.m. check-in time. Rick at the front desk was more than helpful and got us the room we had reserved, the oversized one bedroom suite (see pictures). We went to Wet-N-Wild after we checked in until it closed at about 6:00 p.m. After changing into dry clothes we went to the evening light snack which is included for free with the price of your room. However, this is way more than a light snack. My wife, who is a picky eater, thought the food was great (I’ll eat anything). They were serving hot dogs, Chinese vegetable egg rolls, buffalo wings, Idaho baked potatoes and assorted chips and salad. While it may not taste very good if you are a gourmand, it tasted great to my family and me. Even my son, who is also a picky eater, ate enough to fill him up. Oh, did I mention that the evening food comes with free alcohol? Three free drinks per adult staying in the room. The hotel not only had beer and wine but also mixed drinks. As stated above, we booked the oversized one bedroom suite. It’s more than big enough for our family. The only drawback is the one bathroom in the suite can only be accessed through the bedroom. Thus, if you have someone sleeping on the fold-out couch in the living room portion of the suite and they have to use the bathroom, they have to go through the bedroom. The kitchen area is huge, probably too large to be using the space effectively. I’m not an architect, but I wonder if they could’ve made the kitchen smaller and somehow provided access to the bathroom through both the bedroom and living area or kitchen. I tried to find faults with this hotel but had trouble doing so; free internet, free breakfast and a large, clean hotel room. If I have to find any fault on the first day of our stay, it’s that the Cajun trail mix served at the nightly snack was stale. That’s a pretty small problem, however. This is how friendly the staff is: the nightly snack and breakfast is a self-serve set-up. After you eat, you throw your paper plates and such away. However, the staff working the food area, if they were not doing anything else, would ask how everything was and clean up anything you had finished. The service was better than some four and five star hotels at which I’ve stayed. The only real fault (Cajun trail mix aside lol) I can find with the hotel is the workout facility, which is small. It has five cardio machines to use but nothing else. The cardio machines are in good shape (three treadmills, one bike and one cross-trainer). Working out may not be important to all travelers, but I’m a workout addict and had limited ability to work out during my vacation. As a recommendation (if anybody from the hotel reads this), perhaps they could make an arrangement with a nearby gym (if one exists) to allow hotel guests to work out. Breakfast is just as good as the evening snack. Waffles, French toast, donuts, sausage eggs, biscuits and gravy, bagels, muffins, cereal, fruit coffee, tea, hot chocolate and juice. There is something for everyone. My son was very disappointed that there were no donuts the second morning of our stay (they ran out). However, they were back the third morning and for the rest of our stay. We spent each day at Wet ‘N Wild and our room was always clean upon our return. Even though we did not use all of the hotel supplied shampoo and soap, housekeeping left new soap and shampoo so there was always at least one sealed item in addition to the one being used. The evening snack (okay, from now on I’m just calling it dinner) on the second day had the baked potatoes and hot dogs again but also meatballs (which were a little dry) and chicken strips (which were fantastic). I didn’t really want the Cajun trail mix again but wanted to taste some of it to see if it was still stale. Apparently, they opened a new bag because it was no longer stale. These items were rotated every other night with the first night food items, with baked potatoes and hot dogs provided every night. In summary, this is one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed at. The staff was extremely friendly and the facilities (except for the workout room) are the best. Rick at the front desk told me they are opening up another Phoenix location closer to downtown in Tempe. The only other recommendation I can think of for this hotel, and this is really being greedy, is to have desert (ice cream, cookies or whatever) with the evening food. Being on vacation and forgetting our diets, we went out for sweets every night after eating at the hotel. Regardless of whether the hotel adds desert to its menu, I’m still planning on going back, as it’s a great value. Side Trip Recommendation 1: Go to Sweet Republic in Scottsdale for ice cream after dinner. It’s a place I read about on the internet before our vacation that has fresh made ice cream and sorbet. It’s quite a drive from the hotel, about 20-25 miles, but it was well worth it. It’s some of the freshest ice cream I’ve ever had…and my wife also loved the oatmeal chocolate chip cookie they had. Side Trip Recommendation 2: The last night we were at the hotel we went to dinner with some friends that live in Phoenix. Go to Paradise Bakery, which is just about 1 mile north of the hotel in the Dick’s Sporting Goods shopping center and movie theater. My wife and I always go to this chain restaurant when we are in Phoenix, as they aren’t yet in Las Vegas. The food is great and their cookies are to die for! Side Trip Recommendation 3: This is the perfect hotel to stay at if you are going to Wet N’ Wild. If you go to the water park just twice, it is cheaper to buy a season pass. This is what we did. In fact, we had so much fun, we are planning to go back (and stay at the Drury Hotel again) in August.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mmjkfamily
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this hotel! The room was clean and comfortable. The pool was great, we swam for hours! The food offered at breakfast and the evening reception was delicious and plentiful. Every staff member we met was friendly and concered about making our stay the best it could be. We will certainly be looking for other Drury Inns on our future travels.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JDtheVP
Reviews.Content: We always try to stay at a Drury Inn after we stayed at one in West Des Moines a couple months ago. This one lived up to our expectations. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The free breakfast is delicious and I liked the cheese and hot sauce next to the scrambled eggs to add a southwestern kick if anyone wants it. We didn't have an opportunity to take advantage of the free wings at night, however. A unexpected surprise - if you are looking for extra outlets, look on the side of the desk - there are three!

Reviews.Title: “Good In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: alvis-f
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel with a caring staff and excellent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good food”
Reviews.Author: Beatledude64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Memorial weekend and to go to the Wet 'n Wild water park near by. We got a suite. The room was great. We went to the free food area for breakfast and dinner and both had good food. The hot dogs, chicken, baked potatoes, and other foods were delicious. I love the fact that they give you good food for free. The pool area was also really cool, I love the indoor/outdoor pool, but the indoor pool area was very chlorinated and humid. The only complaints I have are that the bathroom doors in the rooms don't have locks and that the second dinner night was low on food, but that was due to a shipping error, the hotel said. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed--not worth the "free" food”
Reviews.Author: Justin1234
Reviews.Content: Although the room was pleasant enough, when I left early morning and returned to my room late in the afternoon, the room was never made up. When I called the front desk about this, they said housekeeping works until 5:30. I have traveled extensively and have never gotten this type of response. I had breakfast in the dinning room twice and both times most of the food items were either gone or down to the bare minimum. One morning we even had to wait quite a long time for milk!!!! There was never anyone at the front desk and when I checked out, the woman who did come to the desk was very uninterested.

Reviews.Title: “the reviews are right!”
Reviews.Author: Klaproth
Reviews.Content: After checking Tripadvisor on this area, and seeing that there was a Roomsaver coupon for it as well, we decided to try it. We had never stayed at a Drury Inn before, but we will now! The hotel was clean and well cared for, the grounds well manicured, room clean and not with the usual "de-odorized" heavy perfume smell. The room was medium size, and well appointed. The reception at 5:30 was well attended, and with good reason- the food was very good, beers were cold. Although a lot of folks were making the reception more of an appetizer to whet appetites for dinner, a few seemed to be making a whole dinner of it! Due to dietary limitations (lactose intolerance) i was not able to sample most of the offerings, but wife assured me that they were all good. The baked potato i did eat was very good. This property definitely deserves its high rating! We'll be trying more Drury Inns in the near future!!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service isn't Dead”
Reviews.Author: HaveBaggsWillTravel
Reviews.Content: WOW ... was my husband's first word when he returned to the car after checking in at this hotel. The lobby area was beautiful and they greeted him with a smile and a hand shake. The rooms were really lovely, the indoor/outdoor pool was great, the breakfast was delicious and the bonus of the generous evening cocktails and appetizers (enough to make a meal of) were far above and beyond the call of duty. The two gentlemen working the cocktail/snack time (Chris & Tim) were really welcoming and personable. And all at a GREAT price. We immediately liked everything about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Rave reviews!! Incredibly clean, superb value, and impeccable service!!”
Reviews.Author: Flagstaffarians
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this new Drury Inn twice in the past month as our boys soccer team had tournaments in the Phoenix area. It was ideally located for us in north Phoenix right by I17. The hotel and rooms were spotless as was the Jacuzzi and indoor/outdoor pool. We definitely enjoyed the free evening drinks and appetizers as well as the delicious free hot breakfast! The staff members were incredibly courteous and helpful to every single youth and adult in our group. We had a number of special requests: a 2 hour early check-in for 7-8 of the rooms, hot breakfast items earlier than the usual 7am, use of the dining area for late night pizza party, and a myriad of different room billing requests . They were able to honor each request graciously and never once made us feel that we might be asking too much. One morning we got back to the hotel after an 8am game, arriving 5 minutes before breakfast was ending. The general manager, Tim, was making the rounds in the breakfast area greeting guests and clearing plates from tables. He made a point to ask the boys about their game and then encouraged them to fill their plates, assuring them that more food was on the way. When I sought him out to thank him personally for our stay, he greeted me by name, asked me about our stay, and assured me that it was his pleasure to be able to serve us well. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone sating in the Phoenix area. Impeccable service and great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great comfy stay!”
Reviews.Author: rickandjeanette
Reviews.Content: The staff was accomodating to our late night arrival. Rooms,floors, showers,walls and everything in between was very clean and pleasant. Beds were comfortable and pillows were fluffy. Unfortunately we missed the free evening food buffet at 530 pm. Breakfast was good enough to get you started back on the road with make your own waffles. My family of 7 enjoyed a good nights sleep in 3 of their rooms. Great clean and comfy place I will stay stay there on our next road trip thru Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff789
Reviews.Content: After staying at a midwestern Drury Inn & Suites the month prior, we decided to stay at the new Drury Inn & Suites Pinnacle Peak for a week vacation in Phoenix. LOCATION: The hotel is located in northern Phoenix, which seemed to be a very nice part of the city. It is right off of the interstate, and the hotel has great access to both I-17 and Loop 101 (a freeway) providing easy access to downtown Phoenix, Scottsdale, and Mesa (our destinations). Unfortunately there is no dining in the immediate area of the hotel, although a nice strip mall/shopping area/restaurants are only about 3-4 minutes north by car. It seemed the hotel was located alongside corporate office buildings and apartment complexes. ROOMS: Our rooms were well furnished and well above expectations for a "moderate" hotel chain. The hotel itself is brand new, and as such everything in the room was spotless. Great flat screen LCD television with HD channels, refrigerator, microwave, tiled bathroom floor, comfortable beds and pillows, and southwestern decor all made the room very enjoyable. The only two complaints I had were 1) the air conditioning is very touchy and is either off or blasts air, and 2) the toilet is a unique water-conserving model that I was not familiar with. HOTEL AMENITIES: The combination indoor/outdoor pool is small, but functional. The whirlpool was decent size and although the parking area was full with guests, the pool area was never crowded. The real advantage to staying at this hotel is the free breakfast and evening reception area. Unlike the previous Drury I have stayed at, this hotel has a large area devoted to the free food and drinks. The free buffet-style breakfasts were outstanding. Scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuits & gravy, and french toast were just some of the offerings on top of the normal continental breakfast foods one would normally find. The free "5:30 Kickback" offerings in the evening seemed to be less impressive, although it was fulfilling enough that we didn't have to go out for dinner some nights. The bartender was superb (surprisingly) and remembered everone's drinks when they would come back to the bar. It should be noted that each guest over 21 years old gets three complimentary alcoholic drinks per evening (wine, beer, and/or basic mixed drinks). The free soft drinks were always available, even though the information in the rooms specified they were only offered from 3pm-10pm...that sure beats having to pay the normal $2 or so for a drink out of the vending machines at most hotels. The hotel even offered free popcorn to snack on in the front lobby. For the late night munchies, the hotel has a small vending area offering frozen pizzas, TV dinners, ice cream, and such for very reasonable prices (usually less than $2 for any one item). STAFF: The hotel staff was all extremely friendly, although seemingly overworked. It seemed at times they had one person running the place in the evening, and there was a slight wait to speak to the front desk person. That being said, I watched as the managers checked on everyone during the meal times and even offered to get some of the elder guests their drinks at the bar! All the staff seemed more than ready to help with directions in the area, general Phoenix information, and special requests. In closing, I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone seeking to travel to the Phoenix area that wants a moderate hotel. Although it is more expensive than your "cheap" travel motels, I definitely felt like I got a great value out of my stay considering we had complimentary breakfasts, drinks, and even some dinners provided for us. We found that the various online travel websites offered prices that were better than the Drury Inn website (even using travel discounted rates like AAA).

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye062
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed here in january having been in the sister hotel in Flagstaff and agree with everything the previous contributor has said.The rooms are fine (would have liked a safe) and aircon is a bit noisy (internal) but for the money it is hard to see how it could be bettered. The staff are very attentive especially at breakfast. The food is good and included so we only had a snack during the day most of the time.Even alchohol is included at the evening meal but for people with big appetites it would not be enough I realise. The location is great and you can be on the freeway in 2 minutes. Loads of carparking space. We especially liked the lounge area with TV screen and large sofas next to a gas log fire. They even provide large round footrests which we thought (being English) were coffee tables to begin with so you can really relax in a lovely setting if you want. So if you are looking for a place to stay to explore the area the DRURY will not dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Drury Suites in Northend of Phoenix along I-17.”
Reviews.Author: gurk123
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at Drury Inn in St. Louis, was impressed, so decided to try here in north Phoenix, and we were happy we did! Brand new rooms with almost everything you need. No freeway noise, matter of fact no noise in the room either. Clean, granite counter tops, tiled floors in bathroom and wet bar area, and 2 Flat screen TV's in suite. Only item missing was an In-room safe. WiFi worked great throughout property, and the free long distance is a great bonus! Breakfast was great, scrambled eggs perfect, along with great options on waffles, juice, cereal, sausage, etc. Evening happy hour also had great snacks like Chili, nachos, baked potatoes, and hotdogs, along with draft beer, house wine and basic mixed drinks. Pool was an indoor/outdoor combo, small but functionable...also a large spa pool. Gym was basic stock, but again did the trick. Lots of parking, not many services within walking distance, but large shopping area just a mile north...Walmart, Dicks sports, theaters, Restaraunts, etc. I-17 easy to get around, 10 minutes back to Metro-Center, 15-20 minutes to Cards stadium, and 20-25 minutes to PHX airport. Twice now impressed with Drury Inn and Suites service and amenities. As long as you have a car, this location was fine, and the property was great! Would stay here again without doubt.

HotelInfo.Name: Drury Inn & Suites Happy Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 2335 W Pinnacle Peak Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85027 (Formerly Drury Inn & Suites Pinnacle Peak)
